content:
âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: I tested in PHP and found no issue.
Clojure stub throws an exception, but it seemes a CG side problem to me.

Ascii art is not everyone's cup of tea, but this puzzle is different enough from what I have seen on CG.
Puzzle is quite easy, might be a fit for a CoC, put IMHO it is still okay as easy solo puzzle for beginners - not all beginners like the time pressure and competitite aspect of CoC.

One more thing. In the input stub: instead of
"read heights:string(100)"
  why don't you go with
"loopline n heights:int"
  ? It would be more semantic and generate better parser code in most languages.

I recommend in the statement, instead of:
"Line 2: a space-separated string heights for height of each mountain"
write: 
"Line 2: a space-separated integer heights for height of each mountain"

Just to be 100% precise, I recommend adding 'output lines shall not contain trailing spaces.

In the stub: 
"loop n write answer"
might be a bit misleading, because the number of lines in output is not n. Maybe a simple "write answer" would be better.

Overall, the puzzle is fine, maybe easy enough for a CoC. But I am ready to approve as 'easy solo' if above minor suggestions are dealt with.

âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: Good puzzle

âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: ASCII Art is always good
Thank you for your recommendation and for pointing out my small mistakes. I have made changes :)
yeah, wasn't being able to get that ðŸ˜…, Thank You

There might some misunderstanding: You modified statement to: "Next n Lines: an integer height for the height of the mountain"
But these n integers are in the same line, space separated.
"loopline n heights:int" does exactly this, so description shall be 
"Line 2: n space-separated integers for the height of each mountain"  to be valid for all the test cases and input stubs.
Just check what default code loopline generates!
sorry, I don't know what I was thinking ðŸ˜… THANK YOU for helping me :) . Is it good now or sth still missing?
